title: Will money still be around in hundreds of years with the advancement of technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Without Question. Money is a way of rewarding people and giving them something in return for goods or services. it is a way of allocating resources (Basic economics). Whilst we have scarcity (lack of resources \ limited resources) we will ALWAYS have the need to use something to trade with. Whilst the nature of the money may change (Instead of payment in metal disks or a sheet of cotton, payments in DNA, Sheep, Anything you can think of, shiny beads) the need for something to help allocate resources will not. We need money to rewards for doing terrible jobs, and a way of giving an incentive to make people work (How cold is this?) Until we have something like Star Trek replicators, we will need money...
